intro: Agasyllis, commonly known as the silverleaf nightshade, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and potatoes. The plant is characterized by its hairy, silver-gray leaves and clusters of small, star-shaped flowers. It produces berries that turn from green to yellow or red as they mature. Agasyllis is often found in rocky or arid environments and is adapted to thrive in dry conditions.
